summary: Oligodendrogliomas are a type of glioma believed to originate from oligodendrocytes or glial precursor cells. They primarily occur in adults but are also found in children, comprising about 5% of all central nervous system tumors. They are characterized by a high rate of recurrence and a tendency to increase in grade over time.
causes: Irradiation of pituitary adenoma (single case report)
symptoms: Headaches associated with increased intracranial pressure
Neurological deficits (e.g., visual loss, motor weakness, cognitive decline)
treatments: Symptomatic treatment (anticonvulsants for seizures, steroids for brain swelling)
